input: The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world. It spans several countries in Africa. Temperatures can be extreme.
output:
The Sahara is the largest hot dust, sand, and warmestsun-baked region on Earth.

  

The Sahara covers a vast area of more than 9.2 million square kilometers across several countries in Africa, including Algeria, Chad, Egypt, Libya, Mali, Mauritania, Morocco, Niger, and Tunisia.
